definitions.definition: Any of the following symbols: ‒ (figure dash), – (en dash), — (em dash), or ― (horizontal bar).
(by extension) The longer of the two symbols of Morse code.
A small quantity of a liquid substance etc.; less than 1/8 of a teaspoon.

definitions.example: There is a dash of craziness in his personality.
Aren't we full of dash this morning?

definitions.definition: (Liberia) A bribe or gratuity; a gift.
A stand-in for a censored word, like "Devil" or "damn". (Compare deuce.)
To run quickly or for a short distance.

definitions.example: I have to dash now. See you soon.
He dashed the bottle against the bar and turned about to fight.
The man was dashed from the vehicle during the accident.

definitions.definition: To mix, reduce, or adulterate, by throwing in something of an inferior quality.
(of hopes or dreams) To ruin; to destroy.
definitions.example: Her hopes were dashed when she saw the damage.

definitions.definition: To complete hastily, usually with down or off.
definitions.example: He dashed down his eggs, she dashed off her homework
